article.headline: Moderna in talks to supply Japan with 40 million doses of COVID-19 vaccine
article.body: Moderna MRNA, +0.09% said it's in talks with the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare of Japan to potentially purchase 40 million or more doses of mRNA-127, its COVID-19 vaccine. Under the terms of this arrangement, the vaccine would be supplied by Moderna and distributed in Japan by Takeda Pharmaceutical Co. TAK, +0.16% beginning in the first half of 2021, if the vaccine receives regulatory approval.
